Export history, subscriptions, playlists and settings

Time after last update before a subscription is considered outdated — %s

Do you think feed loading is too slow? If so, try enabling fast loading (you can change it in settings or by pressing the button below).

BlayTube offers two feed loading strategies:
• Fetching the whole subscription channel, which is slow but complete.
• Using a dedicated service endpoint, which is fast but usually not complete.

The difference between the two is that the fast one usually lacks some information, like the item's duration or type (can't distinguish between live videos and normal ones) and it may return less items.

YouTube is an example of a service that offers this fast method with its RSS feed.

So the choice boils down to what you prefer: speed or precise information.
Available in some services, it is usually much faster but may return a limited amount of items and often incomplete information (e.g. no duration, item type, no live status).
Fetch from dedicated feed when available
This content is not available in your country.

string.description: Content description for an icon that appears in the title area of a dialog
string.name: icon_content_description

resources.string: Overrides your current history, subscriptions, playlists and (optionally) settings
Keep in mind this operation can be network expensive.\n\nDo you want to continue?
Do you want to also import settings?

Import a SoundCloud profile by typing either the URL or your ID:

1. Enable "desktop mode" in a web-browser (the site is not available for mobile devices)
2. Go to this URL: %1$s
3. Log in when asked
4. Copy the profile URL you were redirected to.

Import YouTube subscriptions from Google takeout:

1. Go to this URL: %1$s
2. Log in when asked
3. Click on "All data included", then on "Deselect all", then select only "subscriptions" and click "OK"
4. Click on "Next step" and then on "Create export"
5. Click on the "Download" button after it appears and 
6. From the downloaded takeout zip extract the .json file (usually under "YouTube and YouTube Music/subscriptions/subscriptions.json") and import it here.

The BlayTube project takes your privacy very seriously. Therefore, the app does not collect any data without your consent.\nBlayTube\'s privacy policy explains in detail what data is sent and stored when you send a crash report.
